intro: Paris bashanensis, commonly known as the Bashan Paris, is a rare and endangered species native to China. It is a member of the Melanthiaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, grass-like foliage and small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as mountain forests. It has a short, rhizomatous root system and produces berries that are toxic to humans. Due to habitat loss and over-collection, it is critically endangered and requires conservation efforts to survive.
